HelpInfo.Entry: FooBar
The worker box allows you to change what type of jobs your worker will work on! The 4 roles are general, crafter, gardener, and synthesizer.

You can move around the world using WASD. You can zoom in and out using the Z/X keys or scrolling. When building use left click to place and right click to destroy. You can also open the inventory using the E key.
Congrats on starting your first space station! Check the science box to see your first task. Good Luck!
Nothing can pass through walls.

Space rock appears randomly throughout the world. One can obtain it by using the mine space rock tool (in the actions box). Once you have it, you can use the workbench to turn it into steel to build walls, metal floors, etc.

The workbench allows you to craft more complex things. To craft, use the manufacture box. Once you click craft, a worker will begin to work on that task. Note: The workbench only works on craftable things. Dirt/Unobtainium require other machines.
Compressors add oxygen to your space station. Note: The room the compressor is in must be enclosed (with walls and floors) or else the oxygen will vent into space.
Saplings need three things to grow: oxygen, dirt, and space. Saplings require a 3x3 area (centered on the sapling) to grow.
Dead plants form when plants (saplings, potatoes, etc.) fail to survive in their environment. To grow, plants need oxygen (at least 15%) and dirt floors.
Dust collectors collect dust from the surrounding gasses. It requires 2 PU / T.
Solar panels produce a constant rate of 1 PU / T.

Unlocks the basics materials that are needed for space station construction. Start by gathering space rock using the mining menu, and then use a workbench to convert the rock into steel. If you ever need help, you can check the help info menu (which can be accessed by clicking on a block in the world or in the build menu).

Once you have set up a small station, you can grow plants for food and resources. Plants require a dirt floor, and oxygen to be present to grow. To get oxygen, use the compressor which collects and compresses the vacuum of space.

Using the composter, you can compost leaves to create dirt. Place down a composter, and use the manufacture menu to select how much dirt to make. A gardener will then place dirt in the composter, wait for it to compost, and then pick it up.
Solar Panels generate electricity which can be used to power different machines. They produce a constant rate of 1 PU / T.
The Arc Reactor uses power ingots to produce a large amount of power. Once built it will run forever, producing 50 PU / T (50x more than a solar panel)!

The synthesizer creates new elements using Space Dust. Similar to the composter and the workbench, you can use the manufacturing menu to schedule recipes, and then your worker will complete them. However, synthesizing will take your workers multiple sessions to complete.
Unlocks the Dust Collector, which collects space dust from the vacuum of space. The dust can then be used by the synthesizer to create new elements such as power ingots, unobtainium, and woodroot.
Unlocks Batteries, which can increase the power capacity of your station.

Unlocks the woodroot recipe to synthesize woodroot seeds. Woodroot is a powerful plant that grows out of parasites within wood particles. The plant takes a long time to grow but provides a lot of food when harvested.
